title: What happens when carbon dioxide reacts with oxygen? Why? - Quora

response.answer_text: O2 and CO2 do not react under ordinary conditions, owing to the thermodynamic stability of CO2 and the large activation energy required for multiple double-bond cleavage.You could imagine O2 + CO2 = O3 (ozone) + CO, where CO2 is reduced to CO and oxygen is oxidized to ozone. However, this reaction is not observed in the atmosphere - instead, the sun breaks down molecular oxygen to give ozone. ... CO2 is necessary for photosynthesis.

Technically you can force them to react to form CO₃, but that takes a lot of coaxing (corona discharge forming plasma of free oxygen atoms which then attack the CO₂), and apparently the stuff falls apart in seconds, forming … you guessed it, CO₂ and O₂. Think about it, if CO₂ and O₂ reacted, what would happen in your lungs? The fact that you exhale a mixture of about 3–5% CO₂ and 16–18% O₂ (plus 78% N₂ and 1% Ar) tells you that they don’t react …
